Package anydev

Class Volume

java.lang.Object
anydev.Volume
public final class Volume extends Object
Volume: Use to quantify any volume of anything NOTE: Internally, the actual value is always stored in CUBIC_M. It is converted when exposing it as needed NOTE: Class is designed to be immutable. Do not allow setters, return deep-copies if aiming to change values... NOTE: class is based on double precision. You may encounter tiny rounding errors

      Parameters:

      public double getVolume(Volume.Unit unit)
      Returns:
      how much volume (in getUnit()s). Will be >=0.

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      NOTE: Does not account for floating-point uncertainty for very small values. Only checks if *exactly* 0!
      Returns:
      true if this volume contains nothing, i.e. volume==0.

    • add

      public Volume add(Volume toAdd)
      Adds given volume to this volume. Returns new (deep-copy) volume with sum of both volumes Accounts for units automatically.
      Parameters:
      toAdd - volume to be added to this volume
      Returns:
      new (deep-copy) volume with sum of both volumes

    • subtract

      public Volume subtract(Volume toSubtract)
      Subtracts given volume from this volume. Returns new (deep-copy) volume with new reduced volume Accounts for units automatically.
      Parameters:
      toSubtract - volume to be removed from this volume. Must be <= this volume
      Returns:
      new (deep-copy) volume that is oldVolume-toSubtract
      Throws:
      ERROR - if toSubtract>thisVolume

    • getAsMass

      public Mass getAsMass(Density withDensity)
      Convert this volume into a mass
      Parameters:
      density - density of this mass
      Returns:
      a mass equal to this volume at given density

    • isLarger

      public boolean isLarger(Volume compareTo)
      Compare this JC_Volume to given JC_Volume to find out if it has a bigger volume Accounts for units automatically
      Parameters:
      compareTo - which volume to compare to
      Returns:
      true if this Volume has bigger (or equal!) volume to given compareTo volume. False if compareTo has larger volume
